title: Quiz 1 - Time and Distance
instruction: Directions (46-50): Pie chart  shows the % time taken by 8 different persons namely A, B,C, D,E,F,G and H to reach a particular point but the starting point is not same and total time taken by all of them together is 500 hr. (partly by car and remaining by train) The line graph shows % distance travelled by car out of total distance travelled by them individually.

quiz.text: If a 200 m long train crosses a platform of the same length as that of the train in 20 seconds, then the speed of the train is :
options: 50 km/hr
60 km/hr
72 km/hr
80 km/hr
None of these

quiz.text: Two trains, each of length 125 metres, are running in parallel tracks in opposite directions. One train is running at a speed 65 km/hour and they cross each other in 6 seconds. The speed of the other train is:
options: 75 km /hour
85 km/ hour
95 km/ hour
105 km/ hour
None of these

quiz.text: A man with three-fifth of his usual speed reaches the destination 2.5 hours late. Find his usual time to reach the destination?
options: 4 hours
3.5 hours
3.75 hours
4.5 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A train running at   of its normal speed reached a place in 22 hours. How much time could be saved if the train would have run at its normal speed?
options: 14 hours
7 hours
8 hours
16 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Walking at three-fourth of his usual speed, a man covers certain distance in 2 hours more than the time he takes to cover the distance at his usual speed. The time taken by him to cover the distance with his usual speed is:
options: 4.5 hours
5.5 hours
6 hours
5 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A man goes from a place A to B at a speed of 12 km/hr and returns from B to A at a speed of 18 km/hr. The average speed for the whole journey is:
options: 14.4 km/hr
15 km/hr
15.5 km/hr
16 km/hr
None of these

quiz.text: Two trains started at the same time, one from A to B and the other from B to A. If they arrived at B and A respectively 4 hours and 9 hours after they passed each other, the ratio of the speeds of the two trains was:
options: 2 : 1
3 : 2
4 : 3
5 : 4
None of these

quiz.text: A starts from a place P to go to a place Q. At the same time, B starts from Q to P. If after meeting each other A and B took 16 and 25 hours more respectively to reach their destinations, the ratio of their speeds is:
options: 3 : 2
5 : 4
9 : 4
9 : 13
None of these

quiz.text: A train of 320 m crosses a platform in 24 seconds at the speed of 120 km/h. while a man crosses the same platform in 4 minutes. What is the speed of man in m/s?
options: 2.4
1.5
1.6
2.0
None of these

quiz.text: A car travel first 39 km distance in 45 minute while next 25 km distance in 35 minutes. What is its average speed?
options: 45 Km/h
35 Km/h
48 Km/h
90 Km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A 280 m long train moving with an average speed of 108 km/h cross a platform in 12 seconds. A boy crosses the same platform in 10 seconds. What is the speed of boy in m/s?
options: 5 m/s
8 m/s
10 m/s
15 m/s
None of these

quiz.text: A truck cover 224 km in 4 hours, the average speed of a bike isth the average speed of the truck how much distance will the bike cover in seven hour?
options: 96 km
98 km
95 km
92 km
None of these

quiz.text: If a person walks at 14 km/h instead of 10 km/h he would have walked 20 km more. The actual distance travelled by him is:
options: 85 Km
50 Km
80 Km
70 Km
None of these

quiz.text: The train fare between Patna to Munger for one adult is three times the train fair of one child if the adult fair is 102 then. What will be the fare of 2 adults and 3 children together for the same distance?
options: 306
212
206
214
None of these

quiz.text: A car travels a distance of 75 km at the speed of 25 km/h. It covers the next 25 km of its journey at the speed of 5 km/h and the last 50 km of its journey at the speed of 25 km/h. What is the average speed of car?
options: 15 Km/h
12.5 Km/h
40 km/h
25 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: If the length of the train is 700 m and length of platform is 500 m find the time taken by the train moving at 54 km/h?
options: 75 sec
80 sec
85 sec
90 sec
None of these

quiz.text: Amit goes to Delhi from Patna at speed of 50 km/h. Distance between Delhi and Patna is 1000 km. He takes rest of 20 minutes every 3 hours of journey. How much time will he take to arrive Delhi?
options: 20 hours
21 hours
22 hours
23 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A car covers a distance of 330 km in a certain amount of time at speed of 55 km/h. What is the average speed of a bike that covers a distance of 15 km less than the car in 1 hour less than the time taken by car?
options: 50 Km/h
60 Km/h
63 Km/h
65 Km/h
None of these

quiz.text: A car traveling at a speed of 40 km/hour can complete a journey in 9 hours. How long will it take to travel the same distance at 60 km/hour?
options: 6 hours
3 hours
4 hours
4.25 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A 75 meter long train is moving at 20 kmph. It will cross a man standing on the platform in
options: 12 seconds
14 seconds
13.5 seconds
15.5 seconds
None of these

quiz.text: In what time will a train 100 meter long cross an electric pole, if its speed be 144 km/hour?
options: 2.5 seconds
5 seconds
12.5 seconds
3 seconds
None of these

quiz.text: A train running at a speed of 60 kmph crosses a platform double its length in 32.4 seconds. What is the length of the platform?
options: 180 m
240 m
360 m
90 m
None of these

quiz.text: A train running at the speed of 66 kmph crosses a signal pole in 18 seconds. What is the length of the train?
options: 330 m
300 m
360 m
320 m
None of these

quiz.text: Two trains of equal length take 10 seconds and 15 seconds respectively to cross a telegraph post. If the length of each train be 120 metres, in what time (in seconds) will they cross each other travelling in opposite direction?
options: 16
15
12
10
None of these

quiz.text: A man covers a certain distance by car driving at 70 km/hr and he returns to the starting point riding on a scooter at 55 km/hr. Find his average speed for the whole journey.
options: 61.6 km/hr
62.8 km/hr
63.6 km/hr
64.6 km/hr
None of these

quiz.text: A boy is running at a speed of p kmph to cover a distance of 1 km. But, due to the slippery ground, his speed is reduced by q kmph (p > q). If he takes r hours to cover the distance, then:
options: r = p + q
r = p q
None of these

quiz.text: A boy goes to the school with the speed of 3 kmph and returns with the speed of 2 kmph. If he takes 5 hours in all, then the distance (in kms) between the village and the school is :
options: 6 km
12 km
8 km
9 km
None of these

quiz.text: A student walks from his house at 5 kmph and reaches his school 10 minutes late. If his speed had been 6 kmph he would have reached 15 minutes early. The distance of his school from his house is :
options: 2.5 km
12.5 km
5.5 km
3.6 km
None of these

quiz.text: A train takes 18 seconds to pass completely through a station 162 m long and 15 seconds through another station 120 m long. The length of the train (in metres) is:
options: 70
80
90
100
None of these

quiz.text: Two trains of lengths 120 m and 80 m are running in the same direction with speed of 40 kmph and 50 kmph respectively. The time taken by them to cross each other is :
options: 60 sec
72 sec
75 sec
80 sec
None of these

quiz.text: A man standing on a railway platform observes that a train going in one direction takes 4 seconds to pass him. Another train of the same length going in the opposite direction takes 5 seconds to pass him. The time taken (in seconds) by the two trains to cross each other will be :
options: 31/9
40/9
49/9
50/9
None of these

quiz.text: A train, 240m long crosses a man, walking along the line in opposite direction at the rate of 3 kmph in 10 seconds. The speed of the train is:
options: 63 km/h
75 km/h
83.4 km/h
86.4 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: The distance between two cities A and B is 330km. A train starts from A at 8 am. and travels towards B at 60 km/hr. Another train starts from B at 9 am. and travels towards A at 75 km/hr. At what time do they meet?
options: 10 am.
10 : 30 am.
11 am.
11 : 30 am.
None of these

quiz.text: Two men are standing on opposite ends of a bridge of 1200 metres long. If they walk towards each other at the rate of 5m/minute and 10m/minute respectively, in how much time will they meet each other?
options: 60 minutes
80 minute
85 minute
90 minute
None of these

quiz.text: Two trains one 160 m and the other 140 m long are running in opposite directions on parallel track, the first at 77 km an hour and the other at 67 km an hour. How long will they take to cross each other?
options: 7 seconds
7.5 seconds
6 seconds
10 seconds
None of these

quiz.text:
Babu starts from his house at a certain time with a certain speed to pick up his girlfriend from office at 5 : 00 PM. One day his girlfriend left the office at 3 : 00 PM and starts walking home at a speed of 40 km/hr and meet Babu on the way who left his home at his usual time. They reached home 40 min earlier than their usual time.

 

Quantity I : Speed of boy.

Quantity II :  of speed of girl.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity 1: Original duration of flight. In a flight of 3000 km an aircraft was slowed down by bad weather. Its average speed for the trip was reduced by 100 km/hr. and the time increased by one hour.

Quantity 2: Usual time of a man who, when walks at th of his usual pace, reaches his office 20 minutes late.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I Difference between the speeds of P and Q if two places A and B are 60 km apart. P and Q start from A at same time & meet 1st time at a place 12 km from B & they reach A after immediate return from B. The speed of slower person is 48 km/hr.

Quantity II Average speed of train if a distance of 600 km is to be covered in 2 parts. In 1st phase 120 km is travelled by train and rest by car and it took total of 8 hrs, but if 200 km is covered by train and rest by car it takes 20 min more.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I The distance of school from Amans house if he reaches school 5 minutes late which walking at 4 km/hr but 10 minutes earlier than scheduled time walking at 5 km/hr.

Quantity II 5 km
options: if quantity I > quantity II
if quantity I < quantity II
if quantity I quantity II
if quantity I quantity II
if quantity I = quantity II or no relation can be established

quiz.text:
Quantity I Distance travelled by the bus to reach point B from point A if a car travels the same distance in 5 hrs and the speed of the bus is 120 km/hr which is 120% of the speed of the car.

Quantity II Distance travelled by a boat to reach point D from point C if the speed of the boat in still water is 15 km/hr and speed of current is 3 km/hr. It goes from point C to D downstream and return back from point D to C upstream in 25 hrs.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II
No relation

quiz.text: What is the average speed of A if the total distance travelled by all of them is 600 km and the ratio of speed of As Car to the speed of his Motorbike is 1 : 4 and the difference between these speeds is 72 km/hr?
options: 30
45
60
80
None of these

quiz.text: What is the total distance travelled by all of them on car only if distance travelled by all of them on Car and Motorbike together is 800 km (closest to).
options: 166
165
168
170
172

quiz.text: Who travelled the maximum distance on motorbike if total distance covered by all of them together on car and motorbike together is 700.
options: D
A
C
F
E

quiz.text: What is the difference between the distance travelled by A on Car and distance travelled by D on Motorbike if total distance is 900.
options: 40.5
41.2
39.6
38.4
None of these

quiz.text: What is the total distance travelled by A, B and C on Car and D, E and F on Motorbike if total distance covered by them on car and motorbike together is 400.
options: 176.2
178.4
179.1
177.8
None of these

quiz.text: Find speed of E by train, if the speed of car is 60 km/hr and time taken by car and train are in the ratio of 4 : 3.
options: 50 km/hr
45 km/hr
km/hr
km/hr
km/hr

quiz.text: Find the speed of D by car. If the speed by train is 22 km/hr and time taken by car is 50% less than the train.
options: 45 km/hr
54 km/hr
36 km/hr
None of these
48 km/hr

quiz.text: If the distance travelled by B, C and D together and E,F,G and H together is same, then find the ratio of average speed of B,C and D together and E,F,G and H together.
options: 6 : 5
8 : 7
7 : 8
5 : 6
7 : 9

quiz.text: Average speed of A and C are in the ratio of 4 : 3 and C have travelled 500 km more than A. Find the speed of A by car if the speed of A by train is 120 km/hr.
options: 80 km/hr
60 km/hr
65 km/hr
75 km/hr
None of these

quiz.text: Total distance travelled by G is 2250 and the speed by train is 45 km/hr. Find the speed of G by car.
options: 50 km/hr
60 km/hr
70 km/hr
40 km/hr
None of these
